titleStmt.title: Bridge Phase 2: Witness fMS, Collation unit C14

body.ab: <milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0091__main__1"/> We passed a few sad hours untill eleven <lb n="c56-0091__main__2"/> o'clock when the trial was to <del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17750__Start"/>begin<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17750__End"/>commence<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17757__Start"/>and<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17757__End"/><mdel>m</mdel>My father <lb n="c56-0091__main__3"/> and E<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17776__Start"/>father<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17776__End"/><del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17779__Start"/>El<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17779__End"/> the rest of the family being obliged <lb n="c56-0091__main__4"/> to attend as witnesses <del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17785__Start"/>Iac<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17785__End"/> I accompanied them to <lb n="c56-0091__main__5"/> the court. During the whole of this wretched <lb n="c56-0091__main__6"/> mockery of justice I sufferred living torture.<metamark>^</metamark><lb n="c56-0091__main__7"/> It was to be decided whether the result of <lb n="c56-0091__main__8"/> my curiosity and lawless<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17804__Start"/>desires<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17804__End"/>devices would cause<lb n="c56-0092__main__1"/> the death of two of my fellow beings. One a <lb n="c56-0092__main__2"/> smiling babe full of innocence and joy, the <lb n="c56-0092__main__3"/> other far more dreadfully murdered with <lb n="c56-0092__main__4"/> every agravation <del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17824__Start"/>ignominy<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17824__End"/> infamy that could <lb n="c56-0092__main__5"/> make that murder <del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17832__Start"/>more terrible<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17832__End"/><mdel>.</mdel>memorable in horror. Justine <lb n="c56-0092__main__6"/> also was a girl of merit and possessed <lb n="c56-0092__main__7"/> qualities which promised to render her <lb n="c56-0092__main__8"/><del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17849__Start"/>little world<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17849__End"/>life happy; now all was to be oblite<lb n="c56-0092__main__9"/>rated in an<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17863__Start"/>d<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17863__End"/> ignominious grave <mdel>–</mdel>; And I the <lb n="c56-0092__main__10"/> cause! A thousand times rather would <lb n="c56-0092__main__11"/> I have confessed myself guilty of the crime <lb n="c56-0092__main__12"/> ascribed to Justine, but I was absent when <lb n="c56-0092__main__13"/> it was committed and such a declaration <lb n="c56-0092__main__14"/> would havebeen considered as the ravings of <lb n="c56-0092__main__15"/> a madman and could not have excul<lb n="c56-0092__main__16"/>pated her who suffered through me.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0092__main__17"/> The <del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17902__Start"/>aff<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17902__End"/> appearance of Justine was <lb n="c56-0092__main__18"/> calm. She was dressed in <del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17908__Start"/>morn<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17908__End"/> mourning and <lb n="c56-0092__main__19"/> her countenance, always engaging, was rendered <lb n="c56-0092__main__20"/> by the solemnity of her feelings exquisite <lb n="c56-0092__main__21"/> -ly beautiful. <del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17917__Start"/>Yet she<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17917__End"/><del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17921__Start"/>Her mann<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17921__End"/> Yet she <lb n="c56-0092__main__22"/> appeared confident in innocence and <lb n="c56-0092__main__23"/> did not tremble although gazed at and <lb n="c56-0092__main__24"/> execrated by thousands. <del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17930__Start"/>fo<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17930__End"/> For all the kind <lb n="c56-0092__main__25"/> ness which her beauty might have <lb n="c56-0092__main__26"/> gained from others was obliterated by <lb n="c56-0092__main__27"/> the rememberance of the enormity she was <lb n="c56-0092__main__28"/> supposed to have committed. She was <lb n="c56-0092__main__29"/> tranquil yet her tranquillity was evident<lb n="c56-0093__main__1"/> constrained – and as her confusion had <lb n="c56-0093__main__2"/> before been adduced as a proof of her guilt <lb n="c56-0093__main__3"/> she worked <del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17956__Start"/>herself<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17956__End"/> up her mind to an appear<lb n="c56-0093__main__4"/>ance of courage. When she entered the court <lb n="c56-0093__main__5"/> she threw her eyes round it and quickly dis<lb n="c56-0093__main__6"/>covered where we were seated – a tear seemed <lb n="c56-0093__main__7"/> to dim her eye when she saw us but she <lb n="c56-0093__main__8"/> recovered herself and <del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17979__Start"/>g<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17979__End"/><del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17982__Start"/>with<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17982__End"/> a look<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17985__Start"/>e<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17985__End"/> of sorrow<lb n="c56-0093__main__9"/>ful affection seemed to attest her utter <lb n="c56-0093__main__10"/> guiltlessness.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0093__main__11"/> The trial began <del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e18001__Start"/>and<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e18001__End"/>listened attentive<lb n="c56-0093__main__12"/>ly wish and after the advocate against her <lb n="c56-0093__main__13"/> had stated the charge several witnesses <lb n="c56-0093__main__14"/> were called. Several strange facts combined <lb n="c56-0093__main__15"/> against her which would have staggered <lb n="c56-0093__main__16"/> any one who had not such prof of her <lb n="c56-0093__main__17"/> innocence as I had. She had been out the <lb n="c56-0093__main__18"/> whole of the night on which the mur<lb n="c56-0093__main__19"/>der had been committed and towards <lb n="c56-0093__main__20"/> morning had been perceived by a <del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e18037__Start"/>farme<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e18037__End"/><lb n="c56-0093__main__21"/><lb n="c56-0093__left_margin__1"/>market-woman not far from the spot where <lb n="c56-0093__main__22"/> the body of the murdered child had been <lb n="c56-0093__main__23"/> afterwards found. <del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e18054__Start"/>He asked her wh<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e18054__End"/><del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e18059__Start"/>She<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e18059__End"/>The woman<lb n="c56-0093__main__24"/> asked <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>her what she did there?–<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e18084__Start"/>for<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e18084__End"/>but she looked <lb n="c56-0093__main__25"/> very <del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e18093__Start"/>stang<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e18093__End"/> strangely and only returned a <lb n="c56-0093__main__26"/> confused <metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0093.04">^</metamark><lb n="c56-0093__left_margin__1"/>&unin<lb n="c56-0093__left_margin__2"/>telligible<lb n="c56-0093__left_margin__3"/><metamark function="displacement">^</metamark> answer<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e18119__Start"/>e<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e18119__End"/>. <metamark function="insert">^</metamark><mdel>S</mdel>She<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e18135__Start"/>came<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e18135__End"/> returned to <lb n="c56-0093__main__27"/> the house about eight o'clock and when <lb n="c56-0093__main__28"/> some one enquired where she had <lb n="c56-0093__main__29"/> passed the night she replied that she <lb n="c56-0093__main__30"/> had been looking <mdel>of</mdel>for the child and <metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e18162__Start"/>enquired<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e18162__End"/>demanded<lb n="c56-0093__main__31"/> earnestly if any thing had been heard con<lb n="c56-0093__main__32"/>cerning him. When the body was brought<lb n="c56-0094__main__1"/> into the house she fell into violent hys<lb n="c56-0094__main__2"/>terics and kept her bed for several <lb n="c56-0094__main__3"/> days. The picture was then produced <lb n="c56-0094__main__4"/> which the servant had found in her <lb n="c56-0094__main__5"/> pocket and when Elizabeth in a falte<lb n="c56-0094__main__6"/>ring voice proved that it was the same <lb n="c56-0094__main__7"/><del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e18208__Start"/>she had<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e18208__End"/>which<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e18215__Start"/>the<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e18215__End"/> an hour before <del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e18218__Start"/>the murder<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e18218__End"/><lb n="c56-0094__main__8"/> the child had been missed,she had placed round <lb n="c56-0094__main__9"/> his neck a murmur of indignation <lb n="c56-0094__main__10"/> and horror filled the court.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0094__main__11"/> Justine was then called on for <lb n="c56-0094__main__12"/> her defence. God kno who reads all <lb n="c56-0094__main__13"/> hearts knows how As the trial had <lb n="c56-0094__main__14"/> proceeded her countenance had altered. <lb n="c56-0094__main__15"/> Surprise horror and misery were strong <lb n="c56-0094__main__16"/> ly expressed. Sometimes she struggled <lb n="c56-0094__main__17"/> with her tears <del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e18252__Start"/>wh<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e18252__End"/> but when she <lb n="c56-0094__main__18"/> was desired to speak she collected her <lb n="c56-0094__main__19"/> powers and spoke in an audible although <lb n="c56-0094__main__20"/> variable voice.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0094__main__21"/> "God knows," she said, "<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e18266__Start"/>w<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e18266__End"/>how entirely I <lb n="c56-0094__main__22"/> am inocent. but I do not pretend to be <lb n="c56-0094__main__23"/> acquitted on account of my protestations <lb n="c56-0094__main__24"/> I rest my innocence <del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e18279__Start"/>a<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e18279__End"/> on a simple <lb n="c56-0094__main__25"/> explanation of the <del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e18287__Start"/>facts<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e18287__End"/>facts which have <lb n="c56-0094__main__26"/> been adduced against me, and I hope <lb n="c56-0094__main__27"/> the character I have always borne will <lb n="c56-0094__main__28"/> encline my judges to a favourable <lb n="c56-0094__main__29"/> interpretation where any <del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e18304__Start"/>fact<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e18304__End"/>circumstance appears<lb n="c56-0095__main__1"/> doubtful or suspicious.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0095__main__2"/> By the permission of Madlle Lavenza <lb n="c56-0095__main__3"/> I passed the evening with an aunt at <lb n="c56-0095__main__4"/> Chêne. One of my cousins returning from <lb n="c56-0095__main__5"/> Geneva said that he had been at the <lb n="c56-0095__main__6"/> house of M. Frankenstein and<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0095__main__7"/> She then related that by the <lb n="c56-0095__main__8"/> permission of Elizabeth she had passed <lb n="c56-0095__main__9"/> the evening of the night on which the <lb n="c56-0095__main__10"/> murder was perpetrated at <mdel>M</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the house of an aunt <lb n="c56-0095__main__11"/> who resided in Chêne a village about <lb n="c56-0095__main__12"/> a league from Geneva. On her return <lb n="c56-0095__main__13"/>at about nine o'clock she met a <del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e18373__Start"/>servant<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e18373__End"/><lb n="c56-0095__main__14"/> man who asked her if she had seen <lb n="c56-0095__main__15"/> any thing of the child who was lost. She <lb n="c56-0095__main__16"/> was frightened at this account, and passed <lb n="c56-0095__main__17"/> several hours in looking for him when <lb n="c56-0095__main__18"/> the gates of Geneva were shut and she <lb n="c56-0095__main__19"/><del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e18393__Start"/>passed<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e18393__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>was forced to remain<mdel>ed</mdel> several hours of the nightin a <lb n="c56-0095__main__20"/> cottage, but unable to rest or sleep, she <lb n="c56-0095__main__21"/> rose early that she might again <lb n="c56-0095__main__22"/> endeavour to find my brother. If she <lb n="c56-0095__main__23"/> had gone near the <del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e18429__Start"/><del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e18429__End"/> spot<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e18433__Start"/>e<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e18433__End"/> where his <lb n="c56-0095__main__24"/> body lay it was without her knowledge <lb n="c56-0095__main__25"/><del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e18441__Start"/>and she had been confused<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e18441__End"/>That if she had been bewildered when ques <lb n="c56-0095__main__26"/> tioned by the market woman, was <lb n="c56-0095__main__27"/><del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e18453__Start"/>that<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e18453__End"/>not surprising when she <del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e18461__Start"/>was so<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e18461__End"/><lb n="c56-0095__main__28"/><del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e18465__Start"/>c<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e18465__End"/> was so wretched <mdel>on</mdel>for the loss of poor <lb n="c56-0095__main__29"/> William. Concerning the picture she <lb n="c56-0095__main__30"/> could give no account. "I know," continued<lb n="c56-0096__main__1"/> the unhappy victim<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18488__Start"/>e<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18488__End"/> "how heavily and fatally this <lb n="c56-0096__main__2"/><del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18492__Start"/>o<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18492__End"/> one circumstance <del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18495__Start"/>we<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18495__End"/> weighs against me <lb n="c56-0096__main__3"/> but I have no power of explaining it and <lb n="c56-0096__main__4"/> when I have expressed my utter ignorance <lb n="c56-0096__main__5"/> I am only left <del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18505__Start"/>w<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18505__End"/><del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18508__Start"/>as any other is to conject<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18508__End"/><del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18510__Start"/>ure<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18510__End"/><lb n="c56-0096__main__6"/> to conjecture concerning the probabilities <lb n="c56-0096__main__7"/> by which it might have been placed in <lb n="c56-0096__main__8"/> my pocket. But <del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18520__Start"/>I<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18520__End"/> here also I am <del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18525__Start"/>at a<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18525__End"/>checked<lb n="c56-0096__main__9"/><del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18535__Start"/>stand<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18535__End"/>I believe that I have have no enemy on earth who <lb n="c56-0096__main__10"/> that I know and none surely who could have <lb n="c56-0096__main__11"/> been so wicked as <del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18551__Start"/>d<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18551__End"/> to destroy me <del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18556__Start"/>so cruelly<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18556__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>wantonly.<lb n="c56-0096__main__12"/> Did the murderer place it there? I know <lb n="c56-0096__main__13"/> of no opportunity afforded him for so doing <lb n="c56-0096__main__14"/> or if I had why should he have stolen <lb n="c56-0096__main__15"/> the jewel to part with it <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>again so soon <del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18588__Start"/>again<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18588__End"/>?<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0096__main__16"/> "I commit my cause to the justice of <lb n="c56-0096__main__17"/> my judges yet I see no room for hope. I <lb n="c56-0096__main__18"/> beg permission to have a few witnesses exam<lb n="c56-0096__main__19"/>ined concerning my character and if the<mdel>n</mdel>ir<lb n="c56-0096__main__20"/>testimony shall not overweighmy supposed guilt<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18623__Start"/>is an apparent<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18623__End"/> I <del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18628__Start"/>shall<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18628__End"/>must<lb n="c56-0096__main__21"/> be condemned although I <del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18638__Start"/>p<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18638__End"/> would pledge <lb n="c56-0096__main__22"/> my salvation on my innocence."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0096__main__23"/> Several witnesses were called who had <lb n="c56-0096__main__24"/> known her for many years and they spoke <lb n="c56-0096__main__25"/> well of her but fear and hatred of the <lb n="c56-0096__main__26"/> crime of which they supposed her guilty <lb n="c56-0096__main__27"/> rendered them timorous and unwilling <lb n="c56-0096__main__28"/><del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18659__Start"/>to speak<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18659__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18666__Start"/>come forward<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18666__End"/>. Elizabeth saw even this last <lb n="c56-0096__main__29"/> resource, her excellent and irreproacha<lb n="c56-0096__main__30"/>ble dispositions & conduct, about to fail<lb n="c56-0097__main__1"/> the accused, when although <del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18689__Start"/>uncalled<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18689__End"/><lb n="c56-0097__left_margin__1"/> violently <lb n="c56-0097__left_margin__2"/> agitated<lb n="c56-0097__main__2"/> she desired permission to speak. "I am" <lb n="c56-0097__main__3"/> said she "the cousin of the unhappy <lb n="c56-0097__main__4"/> child who was murdered or rather his <lb n="c56-0097__main__5"/> sister for I was educated <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>by and lived <lb n="c56-0097__main__6"/> with his parents <del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18724__Start"/>s<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18724__End"/> ever <del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18727__Start"/>sin<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18727__End"/> since and <lb n="c56-0097__main__7"/> long before his birth; it may therefore <lb n="c56-0097__main__8"/> be judged indecent in me to come <lb n="c56-0097__main__9"/> forward on this occasion but when <lb n="c56-0097__main__10"/> I see a fellow creature about to perish <lb n="c56-0097__main__11"/> through the cowardice of her pretended <lb n="c56-0097__main__12"/> friends I wish to be allowed to speak that <lb n="c56-0097__main__13"/> I may say what I know of her character. <lb n="c56-0097__main__14"/><del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18750__Start"/>and<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18750__End"/> I <del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18755__Start"/>know a great deal<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18755__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>am well acquainted with it.<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18766__Start"/>for<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18766__End"/> I have <lb n="c56-0097__main__15"/> lived in the same house with her at <lb n="c56-0097__main__16"/> one time for five and afterwards for <lb n="c56-0097__main__17"/> nearly two years. During all that <del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18778__Start"/>time<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18778__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>period<lb n="c56-0097__main__18"/> she <del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18791__Start"/><del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18791__End"/> appeared to me a most amiable <lb n="c56-0097__main__19"/> and benevolent creature. She nurst <lb n="c56-0097__main__20"/> my aunt in her last illness with the <lb n="c56-0097__main__21"/> greatest affection and care and after <lb n="c56-0097__main__22"/> terwards attended her <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>own mother during a <lb n="c56-0097__main__23"/> long & tedious illness <del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18815__Start"/>w<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18815__End"/> in a manner <lb n="c56-0097__main__24"/> that excited the admiration of all <lb n="c56-0097__main__25"/> who knew her. After which she again <lb n="c56-0097__main__26"/> lived in my uncle's house where she <lb n="c56-0097__main__27"/> was <del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18829__Start"/>always a favourite<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18829__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>beloved by all the family. <del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18840__Start"/>Of the deceased<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18840__End"/><lb n="c56-0097__main__28"/> she was <del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18848__Start"/>very<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18848__End"/><del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18851__Start"/>fond<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18851__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>warmly attached to <mdel>of</mdel> the child who has been murdered and acted towards him <lb n="c56-0097__main__29"/><del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18866__Start"/>in<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18866__End"/> like a most affectionate Mother.<lb n="c56-0097__main__30"/> for my own part I do not hesitate to <lb n="c56-0097__main__31"/><del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18876__Start"/>s<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18876__End"/>ay that not withstanding <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>all the evidence<lb n="c56-0098__main__1"/><lb n="c56-0098__left_margin__1"/>produced against her I believe and rely <mdel>i</mdel>on <lb n="c56-0098__main__2"/> her perfect innocence. <del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18913__Start"/>An<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18913__End"/> She had <lb n="c56-0098__main__3"/> no<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18919__Start"/>t<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18919__End"/> temptation <del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18923__Start"/>and her dispo character<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18923__End"/><del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18926__Start"/>whi<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18926__End"/> for such an action<lb n="c56-0098__main__4"/><del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18931__Start"/>is amiable<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18931__End"/><del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18934__Start"/>for<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18934__End"/> as to the bauble on which <lb n="c56-0098__main__5"/> the chief proof rests <del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18941__Start"/>If<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18941__End"/><del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18944__Start"/>s<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18944__End"/><mdel>I</mdel><mdel>I</mdel> if she had <lb n="c56-0098__main__6"/> earnestly wished for it I should have <lb n="c56-0098__main__7"/> willingly given it her so much <del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18966__Start"/>did<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18966__End"/> do <lb n="c56-0098__main__8"/><del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18970__Start"/>I rely<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18970__End"/> I esteem and value her."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0098__main__9"/> Excellent Elizabeth! A murmur <lb n="c56-0098__main__10"/> of approbation <del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18980__Start"/>o<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18980__End"/> was heard, but it <lb n="c56-0098__main__11"/> was <del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18987__Start"/>on her account<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18987__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>excited by her generous interference& not in favour <lb n="c56-0098__main__12"/> of poor Justine on whom the public <lb n="c56-0098__main__13"/><del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e19002__Start"/>ig<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e19002__End"/> indignationwas turned with renewed <lb n="c56-0098__main__14"/> violence, charging herwith the blackest in- <lb n="c56-0098__main__15"/> gratitude. <del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e19016__Start"/>For<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e19016__End"/> She herself wept as <lb n="c56-0098__main__16"/> Elizabeth spoke but she did not <lb n="c56-0098__main__17"/> answer. My own agitation<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>& anguish was extreme <lb n="c56-0098__main__18"/><del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e19034__Start"/>wh<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e19034__End"/> during the whole of the trial. The <lb n="c56-0098__main__19"/> picture was I believed in her inno<lb n="c56-0098__main__20"/>cence I knew it. Could the monster <lb n="c56-0098__main__21"/> who had (I did not for a minute <lb n="c56-0098__main__22"/> doubt) murdered my brother, alo in <lb n="c56-0098__main__23"/> his hellish sporthave betrayed the inno<lb n="c56-0098__main__24"/>cent to death and ignominy. I could <lb n="c56-0098__main__25"/> not sustain the horror of my situa <lb n="c56-0098__main__26"/> tion and when I saw that the popu<lb n="c56-0098__main__27"/>lar voice and the countenance of the<lb n="c56-0099__main__1"/> Judges had already condemned <metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0099.01">X</metamark><lb n="c56-0099__left_margin__1"/>the accu<lb n="c56-0099__left_margin__2"/>sed<lb n="c56-0099__left_margin__3"/><metamark function="displacement">X</metamark>my un<lb n="c56-0099__left_margin__4"/>happy<lb n="c56-0099__left_margin__5"/> victim<del loc="c56-0099__main__d1e19119__Start"/>her<del loc="c56-0099__main__d1e19119__End"/><lb n="c56-0099__main__2"/> I rushed out of the court in agony. The <lb n="c56-0099__main__3"/> tortures of the accused did not equal <lb n="c56-0099__main__4"/> mine she was sustained by innocence <lb n="c56-0099__main__5"/> but the fangs of remorse tore my bosom– <lb n="c56-0099__main__6"/> I passed a night of unmingled wretched<lb n="c56-0099__main__7"/>ness. In the morning I went to the <lb n="c56-0099__main__8"/> court; my lips and throat were <lb n="c56-0099__main__9"/> parched. I dared not ask the fatal <lb n="c56-0099__main__10"/> question – but I was known and the <lb n="c56-0099__main__11"/> officer guessed <del loc="c56-0099__main__d1e19155__Start"/>what I came to en-<del loc="c56-0099__main__d1e19155__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the cause of my visit<lb n="c56-0099__main__12"/><del loc="c56-0099__main__d1e19165__Start"/>quire;<del loc="c56-0099__main__d1e19165__End"/> — the ballots had been thrown <lb n="c56-0099__main__13"/> they were all <del loc="c56-0099__main__d1e19173__Start"/>blak<del loc="c56-0099__main__d1e19173__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>black& Justine was <lb n="c56-0099__main__14"/> condemned.<lb n="c56-0100__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c56-0100.01" unit="tei:head"/>Chapter 1<mdel>1</mdel>2<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0100__main__2"/> I cannot attempt to describe what I <lb n="c56-0100__main__3"/> then felt – I had <del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e19210__Start"/>had<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e19210__End"/>experienced sensations of horror <lb n="c56-0100__main__4"/> before and I have endeavoured to bestow <lb n="c56-0100__main__5"/> on them adequate expressions but now <lb n="c56-0100__main__6"/> words cannot convey any idea of the <lb n="c56-0100__main__7"/> heart sickening despair that I <del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e19227__Start"/>then felt<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e19227__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>endured. <lb n="c56-0100__main__8"/><del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e19240__Start"/>Nor<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e19240__End"/> The person to whom I had addressed <lb n="c56-0100__main__9"/> myself also added that Justine had al<lb n="c56-0100__main__10"/>ready confessed her guilt. "That evidence" he <lb n="c56-0100__main__11"/> observed –"was hardly required in so glaring <lb n="c56-0100__main__12"/> a case but I <del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e19256__Start"/>I<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e19256__End"/> am glad of it; and indeed <lb n="c56-0100__main__13"/> none of our judges like to condemn a <lb n="c56-0100__main__14"/><del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e19262__Start"/>ch<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e19262__End"/> criminal upon circumstantial evi<lb n="c56-0100__main__15"/>dence<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e19272__Start"/>let it<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e19272__End"/> be<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>it ever so decisive."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0100__main__16"/> When I returned home Elizabeth <lb n="c56-0100__main__17"/> eagerly <del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e19294__Start"/>enquired<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e19294__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>demanded the result. "My cousin" <lb n="c56-0100__main__18"/> replied I, "it is decided as you may have <lb n="c56-0100__main__19"/> suspected – <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>allJudges had rather that ten <lb n="c56-0100__main__20"/> innocent should suffer tha<mdel>t</mdel>n that <lb n="c56-0100__main__21"/> one guilty should escape: but she <lb n="c56-0100__main__22"/> has confessed."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0100__main__23"/> This was a <del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e19336__Start"/>b<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e19336__End"/> dire blow to poor Eliza<lb n="c56-0100__main__24"/>beth who had relied with firmness on <lb n="c56-0100__main__25"/> her innocence. "Alas!" said she "How <lb n="c56-0100__main__26"/> shall I ever again believe in human <lb n="c56-0100__main__27"/> benovolence – Justine, whom I loved and <lb n="c56-0100__main__28"/> esteemed as my sister. How could she <lb n="c56-0100__main__29"/> put on <del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e19356__Start"/>thos<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e19356__End"/> those smiles of innocence <lb n="c56-0100__main__30"/> only to betray– her mild eyes seemed inca<lb n="c56-0101__main__1"/>pable of any severity or ill humour and <lb n="c56-0101__main__2"/> yet she has <del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e19375__Start"/>com<del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e19375__End"/> committed a murder."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0101__main__3"/> Soon after we heard that the <lb n="c56-0101__main__4"/> poor victim had expressed a wish to <lb n="c56-0101__main__5"/> see my cousin. My father wished her not <lb n="c56-0101__main__6"/> to go but said that he left it to her <lb n="c56-0101__main__7"/> own judgement and feelings to decide. <lb n="c56-0101__main__8"/> "Yes," said Elizabeth "I will go although <lb n="c56-0101__main__9"/> she is guilty – and you Victor shall acco<lb n="c56-0101__main__10"/>pany me –I cannot go alone". <del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e19402__Start"/>This<del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e19402__End"/> The <lb n="c56-0101__main__11"/> idea of this visit was torture to me <lb n="c56-0101__main__12"/> yet I could not refuse.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0101__main__13"/> We entered the gloomy prison cham<lb n="c56-0101__main__14"/>ber and beheld Justine sitting on some <lb n="c56-0101__main__15"/> straw at the further end; her hands <lb n="c56-0101__main__16"/> were mannacled and her head rested <lb n="c56-0101__main__17"/> on her <del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e19427__Start"/>knews<del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e19427__End"/> knees,– she rose on seeing <lb n="c56-0101__main__18"/> us and when <del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e19432__Start"/>th<del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e19432__End"/> we were left alone <lb n="c56-0101__main__19"/> with her she threw herself at the <lb n="c56-0101__main__20"/> feet of Elizabeth weeping bitterly.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0101__main__21"/> My cousin wept also – Oh Justine <lb n="c56-0101__main__22"/> said she, why did you rob me of my <lb n="c56-0101__main__23"/> last consolation – I <del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e19451__Start"/>believed<del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e19451__End"/>relied<mdel>i</mdel>on your <lb n="c56-0101__main__24"/> innocence and although I was very <lb n="c56-0101__main__25"/><del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e19470__Start"/>wh<del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e19470__End"/> wretched I was not so miserable <lb n="c56-0101__main__26"/> as I am now."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0101__main__27"/> "And do you also believe that I am <lb n="c56-0101__main__28"/> so very very wicked–?<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>Cried Justine Do you also join <lb n="c56-0101__main__29"/> with my enemies to crush me? Her <lb n="c56-0101__main__30"/> voice was suffocated <mdel>in</mdel>with sobs.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0101__main__31"/> "Rise my poor girl," said Elizabeth <lb n="c56-0101__main__32"/> "why do you kneel if you are innocent<lb n="c56-0102__main__1"/> I am not one of your enemies, I believed in <lb n="c56-0102__main__2"/> your innocence notwithstanding every <lb n="c56-0102__main__3"/> evidence untill I heard that you had <lb n="c56-0102__main__4"/> yourself declared your guilt. That report <lb n="c56-0102__main__5"/> you say is false, and be assured my <lb n="c56-0102__main__6"/> dear Justine nothing can for a minute <lb n="c56-0102__main__7"/> shake my confidence in you but <lb n="c56-0102__main__8"/> your own confession–"<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0102__main__9"/> "I did confess" said Justine "but <lb n="c56-0102__main__10"/> I confessed a lie. I confessed that I <lb n="c56-0102__main__11"/> might obtain absolution but now <lb n="c56-0102__main__12"/> that falsehood lies heavier at my <lb n="c56-0102__main__13"/> heart than all my other sins. The God <lb n="c56-0102__main__14"/> of heaven forgive me! Ever since I <lb n="c56-0102__main__15"/> was condemned my confessor has besieged <lb n="c56-0102__main__16"/> me,– he threatened and menaced untill <lb n="c56-0102__main__17"/> I almost began to think that I was <lb n="c56-0102__main__18"/> the wicked wretch he said I was. He <lb n="c56-0102__main__19"/> threatened excomunication and Hell <lb n="c56-0102__main__20"/> fire in my last moments if I con<lb n="c56-0102__main__21"/>tinued obdurate. Dear Lady, I had none <lb n="c56-0102__main__22"/> to support me – all looked on me <lb n="c56-0102__main__23"/> as a wretch doom to ignominy and <lb n="c56-0102__main__24"/> perdition; what could I do? In an evil <lb n="c56-0102__main__25"/> hour I <del loc="c56-0102__main__d1e19582__Start"/>confessed<del loc="c56-0102__main__d1e19582__End"/> subscribed to a lie <lb n="c56-0102__main__26"/> and now only I am truly miserable." She <lb n="c56-0102__main__27"/> paused, weeping, and then continued. <lb n="c56-0102__main__28"/> "I thought with horror, my sweet lady, <lb n="c56-0102__main__29"/> that you should <del loc="c56-0102__main__d1e19594__Start"/>sho<del loc="c56-0102__main__d1e19594__End"/> believe that<lb n="c56-0103__main__1"/> your Justine whom your bessed <lb n="c56-0103__main__2"/> aunt had so highly honoured and <lb n="c56-0103__main__3"/> whom you loved, was a wretch capa<lb n="c56-0103__main__4"/>ble of<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>a crime which <del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19627__Start"/>not<del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19627__End"/>none but the <lb n="c56-0103__main__5"/> devil himself <del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19638__Start"/>was capable of<del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19638__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>could have perpetrated. Dear <lb n="c56-0103__main__6"/> William, dearest blessed child, I soon <lb n="c56-0103__main__7"/> shall see you again in heaven &<lb n="c56-0103__main__8"/> glory and that consoles me going as <lb n="c56-0103__main__9"/> I am to suffer ignominy and de"ath.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0103__main__10"/> "Oh Justine" cried the weeping <lb n="c56-0103__main__11"/> Elizabeth, "forgive me for having for <lb n="c56-0103__main__12"/> one moment distrusted you – <del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19670__Start"/>But<del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19670__End"/><lb n="c56-0103__main__13"/> why didyou confess? But do not mourn <lb n="c56-0103__main__14"/> my dear girl, I will every where <lb n="c56-0103__main__15"/> proclaim your innocence and will <lb n="c56-0103__main__16"/> force belief. Yet you must die – <lb n="c56-0103__main__17"/> you my companion, my playfellow, <lb n="c56-0103__main__18"/> my more than sister— die –I never <lb n="c56-0103__main__19"/> never can survive so horrible <lb n="c56-0103__main__20"/> a misfortune".<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0103__main__21"/> "Dear Sweet lady," do not weep"– <lb n="c56-0103__main__22"/><del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19699__Start"/>sai<del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19699__End"/> replied Justine"– you ought to <lb n="c56-0103__main__23"/> raise me <del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19704__Start"/>w<del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19704__End"/> with thoughts of a better <lb n="c56-0103__main__24"/><del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19711__Start"/>world<del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19711__End"/>life, and elevate me from the <lb n="c56-0103__main__25"/> petty cares of this world of injustice <lb n="c56-0103__main__26"/> and strife –Do not you, excellent <lb n="c56-0103__main__27"/> Elizabeth drive me to despair."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0103__main__28"/> Elizabeth <del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19729__Start"/>Em<del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19729__End"/> embraced the suffer <lb n="c56-0103__main__29"/> er "I will try to comfort you," said she,<lb n="c56-0104__main__1"/> but this I fear is an evil too deep and poignant <lb n="c56-0104__main__2"/> to admit of consolation <del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19748__Start"/>or<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19748__End"/> for there is no hope <lb n="c56-0104__main__3"/> Yet heaven bless thee, my dearest Justine, <lb n="c56-0104__main__4"/> with resignation and <del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19758__Start"/>a hope<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19758__End"/>a confidence elevated <lb n="c56-0104__main__5"/> beyond this world. Oh how I hate all its shews <lb n="c56-0104__main__6"/> and mockeries.– When one creature is <lb n="c56-0104__main__7"/><del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19772__Start"/>deprived of life<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19772__End"/>murdered<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19782__Start"/>they<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19782__End"/><del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19785__Start"/>bel<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19785__End"/>another is immediately mur<lb n="c56-0104__main__8"/>der<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19800__Start"/>another<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19800__End"/>deprive of life in a slow torturing <lb n="c56-0104__main__9"/> manner &<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>then the executioners their hands yet reeking with the blood of innocence believe that they have done <lb n="c56-0104__main__10"/>a great <del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19833__Start"/>things<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19833__End"/>deed. They call this retribution; hate<lb n="c56-0104__main__11"/>ful name! When that <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>word is pronounced <lb n="c56-0104__main__12"/> I know that greater and more horrid <lb n="c56-0104__main__13"/> punishments are going to be inflicted <lb n="c56-0104__main__14"/> than the gloomiest tyrant has <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>everin<lb n="c56-0104__main__15"/> ventented to satiatehis utmost revenge. Yet this <lb n="c56-0104__main__16"/> is not consolation <mdel>to</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>for you, my Justine, <lb n="c56-0104__main__17"/> unless indeed that you may glory <lb n="c56-0104__main__18"/> in escaping so miserable a den. Alas! <lb n="c56-0104__main__19"/> I would I were <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>in peace with my aunt & my <lb n="c56-0104__main__20"/> sweet William – <del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19925__Start"/>in peace<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19925__End"/> escaped <lb n="c56-0104__main__21"/> from light which <del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19933__Start"/>I abhor<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19933__End"/>is hateful to me and the <lb n="c56-0104__main__22"/> visages of men which are hateful to <lb n="c56-0104__main__23"/> me." I abhor.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0104__main__24"/> Justine smiled languidly. "This, dear Lady <lb n="c56-0104__main__25"/> said she is despair and not resignation. <lb n="c56-0104__main__26"/> I must not learn the lesson that you <lb n="c56-0104__main__27"/> would teach me – talk of somthing else <lb n="c56-0104__main__28"/><del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19961__Start"/>of fields<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19961__End"/><del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19964__Start"/>s<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19964__End"/> of something that will <del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19967__Start"/>brig jo<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19967__End"/><lb n="c56-0104__main__29"/> bring joy and not encrease of misery."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0105__main__1"/> During this conversation I had retired <lb n="c56-0105__main__2"/> to a corner of the prison-room where <lb n="c56-0105__main__3"/> I could conceal the horrid anguish <lb n="c56-0105__main__4"/> that possessed me– Despair! Who dared <lb n="c56-0105__main__5"/> talk of that? The poor victim who <lb n="c56-0105__main__6"/> on the morrow was to pass the <lb n="c56-0105__main__7"/> dreary boundary of life & death felt <lb n="c56-0105__main__8"/> not as I did — Such deep & bitter agony <lb n="c56-0105__main__9"/> I gnashed my teeth and ground them <lb n="c56-0105__main__10"/><del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e20003__Start"/><del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e20003__End"/> together uttering a groan that came <lb n="c56-0105__main__11"/> from my inmost soul. Justine started <lb n="c56-0105__main__12"/><del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e20009__Start"/>and<del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e20009__End"/> when she saw wh<mdel>a</mdel>o<mdel>t</mdel> it was <lb n="c56-0105__main__13"/> she approached me. "Dear Sir," said <lb n="c56-0105__main__14"/> she, "you are very kind to visit me; <lb n="c56-0105__main__15"/> you I hope do not believe that I am <lb n="c56-0105__main__16"/> guilty."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0105__main__17"/><del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e20036__Start"/>"<del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e20036__End"/>I could not answer – "No Justine" <lb n="c56-0105__main__18"/> said Elizabeth; "he is <del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e20042__Start"/>even<del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e20042__End"/> more <lb n="c56-0105__main__19"/> convinced of your innocence than <lb n="c56-0105__main__20"/> I was for even when he heard <lb n="c56-0105__main__21"/> that you had confessed he did not <lb n="c56-0105__main__22"/><del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e20055__Start"/>believe<del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e20055__End"/>credit it."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0105__main__23"/> "I truly thank him"– said Justine <lb n="c56-0105__main__24"/> "In these last minutes I feel the <lb n="c56-0105__main__25"/> sincerest gratitude for those who <lb n="c56-0105__main__26"/> still think of me with kindness. How <lb n="c56-0105__main__27"/> sweet is the affection of others to <lb n="c56-0105__main__28"/> such a wretch as I am – It removes <lb n="c56-0105__main__29"/> more than half my misfortune <lb n="c56-0105__main__30"/> and I feel as if I could die in <del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e20086__Start"/>pea<del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e20086__End"/><lb n="c56-0106__main__1"/> peace. <del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20095__Start"/>thn<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20095__End"/> now that my innocence isacknow<lb n="c56-0106__main__2"/>ledged by you, sweet lady, and your cousin."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0106__main__3"/> Thus the poor sufferer <del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20110__Start"/>cr<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20110__End"/> tried <lb n="c56-0106__main__4"/> to comfort others and herself. She indeed <lb n="c56-0106__main__5"/> gained the resignation she wished for <lb n="c56-0106__main__6"/> but I the true murderer <del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20120__Start"/>w<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20120__End"/> felt <lb n="c56-0106__main__7"/> the never dying worm alive <del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20127__Start"/>and I was<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20127__End"/>which<lb n="c56-0106__main__8"/> allowed no hope or consolation. Eliza<lb n="c56-0106__main__9"/>beth also wept and was unhappy but <lb n="c56-0106__main__10"/> hers<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>also was <del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20155__Start"/>also<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20155__End"/> the misery of innocence <lb n="c56-0106__main__11"/><del loc="c56-0106__left_margin__d1e20164__Start"/>that<del loc="c56-0106__left_margin__d1e20164__End"/>which like a cloud <del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20174__Start"/>that<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20174__End"/>that passes over the <lb n="c56-0106__main__12"/> fair moon <del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20185__Start"/>which<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20185__End"/>& for a while <lb n="c56-0106__main__13"/><mdel>hi</mdel>des but cannot <del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20200__Start"/>disturb<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20200__End"/>destroy its brightness <lb n="c56-0106__main__14"/><del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20209__Start"/>but<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20209__End"/><del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20212__Start"/>misery<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20212__End"/><del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20215__Start"/>&<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20215__End"/><del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20218__Start"/>desp<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20218__End"/> anguish and <lb n="c56-0106__main__15"/> despair had <del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20224__Start"/>penetr<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20224__End"/> penetrated into <lb n="c56-0106__main__16"/> the core of my heart – I bore a hell <lb n="c56-0106__main__17"/> within me that nothing could <del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20233__Start"/>diminish<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20233__End"/><mdel>.</mdel>extinguish.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0106__main__18"/> We staid several hours with Justine <lb n="c56-0106__main__19"/> and <del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20249__Start"/>with<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e20249__End"/> it was with great difficulty <lb n="c56-0106__main__20"/> that Elizabeth tore herself away <lb n="c56-0106__main__21"/> "I wish" cried she that I were to die <lb n="c56-0106__main__22"/> with you – I cannot live in th<mdel>e</mdel>is world <lb n="c56-0106__main__23"/> of misery." Justine assumed an air <lb n="c56-0106__main__24"/> of Cheerfullness whi<mdel>ch</mdel>le she with diffi<lb n="c56-0106__main__25"/>culty repressed the bitter tears – "Farewell <lb n="c56-0106__main__26"/> sweet lady, dearest Elizabeth may heaven <lb n="c56-0106__main__27"/> in its bounty bless and preserve you<lb n="c56-0107__main__1"/> May this be the last misfortune that <lb n="c56-0107__main__2"/> you will ever suffer. – live & be happy <lb n="c56-0107__main__3"/> to make <del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e20303__Start"/>of<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e20303__End"/> others so.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0107__main__4"/> As We returned Elizabeth said, You <lb n="c56-0107__main__5"/> do not know, my dear Victor, <del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e20313__Start"/>w<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e20313__End"/> how <lb n="c56-0107__main__6"/> much I am relieved now that I trust <lb n="c56-0107__main__7"/> in the innocence of this unfortunate <lb n="c56-0107__main__8"/> girl. I never could again have <lb n="c56-0107__main__9"/> known peace if I had been deceived <lb n="c56-0107__main__10"/> in my reliance on her. For the mo<lb n="c56-0107__main__11"/>ment that I did believe it I felt <lb n="c56-0107__main__12"/><del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e20335__Start"/>such<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e20335__End"/> anguish that I could not have <lb n="c56-0107__main__13"/> long sustained. Now my heart is light<lb n="c56-0107__main__14"/>ened. The innocent suffers – but she <lb n="c56-0107__main__15"/> whom I thought amiable and good <lb n="c56-0107__main__16"/> is not wicked and I am consoled."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0107__main__17"/>Amiable<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e20359__Start"/>Sweet<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e20359__End"/> Cousin! Such were your <lb n="c56-0107__main__18"/> thoughts mild and gentle as your <lb n="c56-0107__main__19"/> dear eyes <del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e20368__Start"/>&<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e20368__End"/><del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e20371__Start"/>gentle tone<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e20371__End"/> and voice.<lb n="c56-0107__main__20"/> but I.—— I was a wretch <del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e20379__Start"/>none<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e20379__End"/>&<lb n="c56-0107__main__21"/> none ever conceived <del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e20385__Start"/>of<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e20385__End"/> the misery <lb n="c56-0107__main__22"/> that I then suffered.
